list_definition.definition: (also microwave oven) an oven that heats or cooks food very quickly using electromagnetic waves

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I generally only use the microwave for cooking rice.

list_definition.definition: to cook or heat something in a microwave

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Microwave the ready meal for three minutes.

list_ex_of_english: In the past, the reliability of the technology was limited by the magnetron used to generate the microwaves.
Water molecules are exposed to intense electromagnetic fields in strong, non-resonant microwaves in order to create heat.
The direct generation of double-quantum coherences is not efficient in the case of weaker microwave pulses as obtainable by commercial instruments.
Advances in satellites, microwaves, and cellular radio are reducing the cost of reaching the remoter rural areas.
By microwaving ants on full power, of course.
Microwaving is simply one method of heating food.
There are a limited number of cases reported in which babies were put into microwaves, though these cases were "not" known to involve any drugs.
We cannot have nuclear-powered microwaves—except in the sense that nuclear power can be fed into the electricity industry and used in microwaves.
